title.narrative: WASH INTERVENTIONS IN PRIMARY SCHOOLS

description.narrative: By 2018, 10% and 30% of primary schools without access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation respectively, have a safe source of drinking water and gender separated sanitation facilities for their pupils who adopt adequate hygiene practices including hand washing with soap., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2016 - Outcome 4 / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): By 2016, populations in provinces with low access to potable water and basic sanitation have an improved access to these services and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, 10% and 30% of primary schools without access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation respectively, have a safesource of drinking water and gender separated sanitation facilities for their pupils who adopt adequate hygiene practices includinghand washing with soap.

description.narrative: In 2018, 25,124 children (12,831 girls and 12,293 boys) gained access to safe drinking water (109 per cent achievement) in 47 schools and 45,757 children (23,336 girls and 22,421 boys) to gender-segregated improved latrines equipped with hand washing facilities in 53 schools with UNICEF Burundi support in eight provinces. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
